meanings.definition: The way in which something is formed or arranged.
meanings.sent1: The conformations of the puzzle pieces made it challenging to put together.
meanings.sent2: The conformations of the chairs in the waiting room were all identical.
meanings.sent3: The conformations of the clouds in the sky seemed to spell out a secret message.
meanings.sent4: The conformations of the trees in the forest created a natural canopy overhead.
meanings.sent5: The conformations of the sand dunes shifted constantly with the wind.

meanings.definition: The act of complying with rules or standards.
meanings.sent1: Her strict conformations to the school dress code never went unnoticed.
meanings.sent2: The company's conformations to safety regulations ensured a secure work environment.
meanings.sent3: His conformations to the traffic laws were so precise, he never got a ticket.
meanings.sent4: The team's conformations to the game plan led them to victory.
meanings.sent5: The chef's conformations to the recipe resulted in a delicious meal.

meanings.definition: The shape or structure of something.
meanings.sent1: The unique conformations of the building made it stand out in the city skyline.
meanings.sent2: The conformations of the DNA molecule determine its function in the body.
meanings.sent3: The conformations of the jigsaw puzzle pieces were so odd, it was hard to connect them.
meanings.sent4: The conformations of the roller coaster track twisted and turned in thrilling patterns.
meanings.sent5: The conformations of the snowflakes were intricate and beautiful under the microscope.
